docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton raised $63 million in July for her presidential campaign, her best month yet and a summertime haul that puts her ahead of President Barack Obama's fundraising at the same point in his re-election race....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton raised $63 million in July for her presidential campaign, her best month yet and a summertime haul that puts her ahead of President Barack Obama's fundraising at the same point in his re-election race.

docs.snippet: In a searing denouncement, President Barack Obama slammed Donald Trump as "unfit" and "woefully unprepared" to serve in the White House on Tuesday. He challenged Republican lawmakers to drop their support for their party's nominee, declaring "Ther...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a searing denouncement, President Barack Obama slammed Donald Trump as "unfit" and "woefully unprepared" to serve in the White House on Tuesday. He challenged Republican lawmakers to drop their support for their party's nominee, declaring "There has to come a point at which you say enough."

headline.main: Obama Says Trump 'Unfit, Challenges GOP to Drop Support
headline.print_headline: Obama Says Trump 'Unfit, Challenges GOP to Drop Support

docs.snippet: The uproar over Donald Trump's criticism of a bereaved Army family put vulnerable Republican senators in a tight spot, underscoring anew the political challenges created for the GOP by its newly minted presidential nominee. And with the general el...
docs.lead_paragraph: The uproar over Donald Trump's criticism of a bereaved Army family put vulnerable Republican senators in a tight spot, underscoring anew the political challenges created for the GOP by its newly minted presidential nominee. And with the general election campaign now squarely underway, the firestorm over Trump's attacks on the Khan family is likely just a taste of trials to come as Republicans negotiate how closely to align with their volatile nominee.

headline.main: Senate Republicans on the Spot Over Trump Comments on Khan
headline.print_headline: Senate Republicans on the Spot Over Trump Comments on Khan

docs.snippet: The billionaire industrialist Koch brothers rejected pressure over the weekend from dozens of big donors in their sprawling political network to back U.S. Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump, saying that their money was better spent try...
docs.lead_paragraph: The billionaire industrialist Koch brothers rejected pressure over the weekend from dozens of big donors in their sprawling political network to back U.S. Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump, saying that their money was better spent trying to influence congressional races.

headline.main: Powerful Koch Brothers Rebuff Big Donors' Calls to Back Trump for White House
headline.print_headline: Powerful Koch Brothers Rebuff Big Donors' Calls to Back Trump for White House

headline.main: The Big Squeeze: This Election Year, It’s All About the Money

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama found common cause with the leader of Singapore in the face of growing political headwinds against the Trans-Pacific Partnership, warning that to "pull up a drawbridge" on trade would only hurt the United States and its workers.
